ARABIC: فَإِنْ أَعْرَضُوا۟ فَقُلْ أَنذَرْتُكُمْ صَٰعِقَةً مِّثْلَ صَٰعِقَةِ عَادٍ وَثَمُودَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If they turn away, then say, 'I warn you of a lightning-bolt like the lightning-bolt of 'Ad and of Thamud.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If even then they turn away, tell them: "I forewarn you of a terrible punishment like the thunderbolt that fell upon the 'Ad and Thamud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But if they turn away, tell them: “I warn you against a sudden scourge like that which struck Ad and Thamud.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If they ignore (your message), tell them, "I have warned you against a destructive blast of sound like that which struck the people of `Ad and Thamud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then if they turn away say, “I warn you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt which came upon A’ad and Thamud.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But if they turn away, then say: "I have warned you of a Sa`iqah like the Sa`iqah which overtook `Ad and Thamud."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But if they turn aside, then say: I have warned you of a scourge like the scourge of Ad and Samood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and to reserve; that is the ordaining of the All-mighty, the All-knowing. But if they turn away, then say, 'I warn you of a thunderbolt like to the thunderbolt of Ad and Thamood.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But if they turn away, then say: I warn you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt (which fell of old upon the tribes) of A'ad and Thamud;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If they turn away, then say, "I warn you of a lightning-bolt like the one which struck the 'Ad and the Thamud:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then if they Still turn away, say thou; I warn you of a calamity like the calamity of the 'Aad and Thamud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But if they turn away, say, ‘I warn you of a thunderbolt, like the thunderbolt of ‘Ad and Thamud.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But if they turn away, say thou: "I have warned you of a stunning Punishment (as of thunder and lightning) like that which (overtook) the 'Ad and the Thamud!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But if they turn away, then say (O Muhammad SAW): "I have warned you of a Sa'iqah (a destructive awful cry, torment, hit, a thunderbolt) like the Sa'iqah which overtook 'Ad and Thamud (people)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But if they turn away, say: 'I have given you warning of a thunderbolt similar to that which overtook Aad and Thamood'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But if they turn away, say, “I have warned you of a thunderbolt, like the thunderbolt of Aad and Thamood.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But if they turn away, then say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt [that struck] 'Aad and Thamud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [41:13] But if they, that is, the Meccan disbelievers, turn away, from belief, after this clear statement, then say, ‘I warn you of, I threaten you [with], a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt of ‘Ād and Thamūd’, in other words, a chastisement that will destroy you like the one that destroyed them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But if they) the disbelievers of Mecca: 'Utbah and his host (turn away) from faith, (then say: I warn you) by means of the Qur'an (of a thunderbolt) of a punishment (like the thunderbolt) like the punishment ((which fell of old upon the tribes) of 'Aad and Thamud; 551
